bibl.title: Letter from C. L. W. to William Y. Hollingsworth, April 20, 1922

div1.p: C. L. W. writes about stegomyia occurring in ditches in New Orleans.

div1.head: Letter from C. L. W. to William Y. Hollingsworth, April 20, 1922
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF THE
COLLABORATING EPIDEMIOLOGIST
FOR THE STATE OF LOUISIANA
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
NEW ORLEANS, LA.
April 20, 1922
Dr. W. Y. Hollingsworth,
U. S. Marine Hospital,
Henry Clay Ave., & Tchoupitoulas St.,
New Orleans, La.,
Dear Bill:
div1.p:
I got in touch with Dr. G. E. Beyer
in regard to stegomyia occurring in mud-lined ditches in
New Orleans. He tells me that to the best of his
knowledge he cannot recall finding them in any such ditches. He says
that he has frequently seen stegomyia larvae in water taken
from gutters in New Orleans but that to the best of his
knowledge these gutters were lined with cypress planks.

I do not believe there is much chance
of getting anything from Mr. Shaw as most of his work
is in rural districts and he spends very little time in
New Orleans.
